org.springframework.web.socket.server

Interface HandshakeHandler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultHandshakeHandler, WebSocketTransportHandler
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    public interface HandshakeHandler
    Contract for processing a WebSocket handshake request.
    Since:
    4.0
    Author:
    Rossen Stoyanchev
    See Also:
    WebSocketHttpRequestHandler

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean doHandshake(ServerHttpRequest request, ServerHttpResponse response, WebSocketHandler webSocketHandler)
      Initiate the handshake.

    • Method Detail

      • doHandshake

        boolean doHandshake(ServerHttpRequest request,
                  ServerHttpResponse response,
                  WebSocketHandler webSocketHandler)
                    throws java.io.IOException,
                           HandshakeFailureException
        Initiate the handshake.
        Parameters:
        request - the current request
        response - the current response
        webSocketHandler - the handler to process WebSocket messages; see PerConnectionWebSocketHandler for providing a handler with per-connection lifecycle.
        Returns:
        whether the handshake negotiation was successful or not. In either case the response status, headers, and body will have been updated to reflect the result of the negotiation
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown when accessing or setting the response
        HandshakeFailureException - thrown when handshake processing failed to complete due to an internal, unrecoverable error, i.e. a server error as opposed to a failure to successfully negotiate the requirements of the handshake request.
